title: The Precedent of Silence
premise: A celebrated civil rights attorney, renowned for forcing corporations to disclose their darkest secrets, takes on a landmark case against a powerful pharmaceutical company. As she uncovers a conspiracy linking a blockbuster drug to a forgotten public health disaster, she realizes her own firm's founding partner was the defense lawyer who buried the evidence decades ago. Now, to expose the truth, she must prosecute the legal mentor who is like a father to her, knowing it will destroy her career, his legacy, and potentially unleash a deadly panic.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a brilliant and idealistic 38-year-old partner at a prestigious Washington D.C. law firm, driven by a need for justice instilled by her mentor.
conflict: Elara's unwavering pursuit of truth forces her into a devastating moral and legal duel against the man who taught her everything, pitting her professional duty against personal loyalty, while a powerful corporation will kill to keep the precedent of silence intact.
setting: Present-day Washington D.C., with flashbacks to a small Appalachian town in the 1970s where the original contamination and cover-up occurred.
tone: Claustrophobic, morally complex, and procedurally intense, blending the high-stakes tension of a courtroom drama with the paranoia of a conspiracy thriller.
